intro: Eumachia savaiiensis, commonly known as the Savaii bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Samoa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the forests of Savaii. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom during the warmer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
